page.title: 05Bowling in Clayton Park
page.content: Every Wednesday afternoon I go bowling with other boys and girls at{Clayton {Park}with my primary school, St. Brigid's. The veterans at the{bowling club asked our Headmaster to let a class go from our school. They explained that there was a lot of {vandalism}in the area and that the bowling green had been damaged several times. They thought that it would be a good idea if some children learned how to play bowls so that they might respect the green. Everybody in our class makes sure that the children around our area know not to spoil the green. The men coach us and if it rains they organise snooker or singing contests. They also tell us about the history of Clayton Park. The Bowls Club is 40 years old and the club room was in Clayton Hall. Later a club room was built near the green.
